notes: Packet 1 describes Tails blast radius as full-session compromise under browser RCE
Packet 2 confirms and adds forensic detail: SANS DFIR shows live RAM imaging yields extensive artefacts
Single-source claim: ~42% of Flatpak apps weaken isolation. No independent corroboration. Confidence capped at 0.70
Packet 1: smallest blast radius under browser RCE
Packet 2: moderate isolation against state-level attacker. Different scope (browser RCE vs state-level) — not contradictory but needs scoping caveat
Tor Project generally discourages VPN+Tor for typical users
PrivacyGuides and some threat models conditionally recommend VPN→Tor to hide Tor usage from ISP
Commercial Tor-mode products are opaque and lack independent verification; some may not use genuine Tor circuits
Original WTF-PAD paper claimed near-random WF accuracy
Later DF evaluation achieves ~90% accuracy against WTF-PAD; Tik-Tok achieves ~93.5%. Not a data contradiction but a significant qualifier: effectiveness depends on attack model generation
